metrics module

Losses used for quantum classifier training.

metrics.BCE_loss(x: Array, y: Array) → Array[source]

Measures the Binary Cross Entropy (BCE) loss between each element in the one-hot encoded target \(x\) and the input \(y\) given by the equations :

\[\ell(x, y) = - \sum_{n=1}^N_\mathbf{x}_n \cdot \log (\mathbf{y}_n),\]

where \(N\) is the batch size.

Parameters:

  • x (Array) – Targets of shape (N, L)

  • y (Array) – Targets of shape (N, L)

Returns:

BCE loss value.

Return type:

Array

metrics.MSE(x: Array, y: Array) → Array[source]

Measures the Mean Squared Error (MSE) loss between each element in the target \(x\) and the input \(y\) given by the equation :

\[\ell_{\text{MSE}}(x, y) = \frac{1}{N}\sum_{n=1}^N\sqrt{\left( x_n - y_n \right)^2},\]

where \(N\) is the number of elements in \(x\) and \(y\).

Parameters:

  • x (Array) – Targets of shape (N, 1)

  • y (Array) – Inputs of shape (N, 1).

Returns:

MSE loss value.

Return type:

Array

metrics.accuracy(targets: Array, class_outputs: Array) → Array[source]

_summary_

Parameters:

  • targets (Array) – _description_

  • class_outputs (Array) – _description_

Returns:

Accuracy caculated between targets and class_outputs.

Return type:

Array

metrics.compute_metrics(loss_type: List[str], targets: Array, preds: Array) → Tuple[Array, Dict[str, Array]][source]

Compute the

Parameters:

  • loss_type (List[str]) – List of strings representing the loss types that are computed.

  • targets (Array) – The ground truth labels.

  • preds (Array) – The predicted labels.

Returns:

A tuple containing the sum of losses that on which the gradient of the parameters is computed, and a dictionary of individual losses.

Return type:

Tuple[Array, Dict[str, Array]]
